BREAST-COMPOSITION: predominantly fibroglandular with areas of fatty tissue (ACR A)
FINDINGS: A suspicious mass is observed in the upper outer quadrant of the breast, measuring approximately 1.2 cm, with irregular margins and spiculated appearance suggestive of high suspicion for malignancy (BIRADS 4B). No significant calcifications are noted. The skin, nipple, and pectoral muscle appear normal. Enlarged lymph nodes in the axilla are also observed.
